channel.title: Education on David John Baker
channel.description: Recent content in Education on David John Baker

item.title: Receiving a Letter of Recommendation
item.description: If you are reading this, you are either thinking about or have asked me to write you a letter of recommendation.

item.title: Thoughts from Teaching Timbre in 2023
item.description: I spent the second half of last week in the UK, doing an in-depth dive on spectrograms at both Goldsmiths and Cambridge.

item.title: A Peculiar Anniversary
item.description: Today marks a peculiar anniversary. As of the 2nd of February, for the first time in my life, I have been at the same job for more than a year.

item.title: Begin the Fugue, Part I
item.description: The past few months have been pretty exhausting. On top of all things lockdown and the global pandemic, a little over a month ago I was told that my job was “at risk” of redundancy.

item.title: Begin the Fugue, Part II
item.description: Vocationtional Vicissitudes After existing in this bootcamp space for the past few months, I feel like I am walking away with a very fresh take on what it means to teach in a vocational, rather than a liberal arts setting.

item.title: Begin the Fugue, Part III
item.description: What’s Next Having coached many people to apply and get their first jobs in the world of data science, I have now seen A LOT of job postings and understand that a JD (job description) is more of a wish list of an ideal candidate rather than a required listing of skills.
